newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Hyundai breaks ground for Indian plant.
newsitem.headline: Hyundai breaks ground for Indian plant.

text.p: Hyundai Motor Co Ltd, South Korea's largest car maker, said on Tuesday it has broken the ground for construction of its $1.1 billion passenger car plant in India.
The plant, in Chennai, Tamil Nadu state, will have an annual capacity of 200,000 units by the year 2001, Hyundai said in a statement.
The plant will begin production in October 1998 and has a capacity of 120,000 units.
The statement said the plant, named "Hyundai Motor India Chennai Plant," will be equipped with facilities for parts production, a research centre and a proving ground.
